message.content:
Some possible reasons for hair getting oily quickly could be:

1. Overwashing: Washing your hair too often can strip it of its natural oils, which signals the scalp to produce even more oil in return.

2. Using heavy conditioners or styling products: Thick and heavy conditioning products can weigh down the hair and make it feel greasier sooner.

3. Touching your hair constantly: Running your fingers through your hair repeatedly or playing with it can transfer oils from your hands to your strands, causing them to become oily faster.

4. Hormonal imbalances: High levels of hormones known as androgens may cause excessive sebum production, leading to an oily scalp and greasy-looking locks.

5. Not brushing enough: Failing to brush regularly spreads out dead skin cells on the scalp that trap dirt, resulting in increased oiliness at the roots of the hair strands.

6. Diet: A diet rich in unhealthy fats or processed foods might increase sebum production and result in oilier tresses more frequently.

7.Validity_DAMAGE_36b9d207_ALT_BELOW
		
8.Environmental factors: Extreme weather conditions such as high humidity or pollution might contribute towards an increased build-up of sweat mixed with excess sebum making hairstreaks look greasier over time
